website_summaries.verdict: A good option for a budget PC build from Corsair with great ventilation and a simple design.
pros: Clean, modern design makes the case suitable for office PC builds
Four hard drive trays support regular and solid state drives
Features accessible USB and audio inputs in the front
cons: Case is made of cheap plastic components that can bend and flex when removing panels

customer_reviews.title: CORSAIR Carbide 100R Mid-Tower Case
customer_reviews.text: since 1 star is the lowest rating i can give no starrs would be more accurate. Very Cheeply Made Terrible Support contacted support explained my problem they finely responde they wanted a copy of the recipt the serial number on the box I told them I was missing some pieces from my case then they sent out some replacment parts but it didn't have what I needed I gave up writing it off as a lesson on Corsair the company Support & there cases. stay clear of Corsair they use to have better products & support not anymore my cases i've used before are COOLER MASTER they are great
customer_reviews.author: Brad Wendt

customer_reviews.title: Utter Garbage
customer_reviews.text: Has only had a few weeks of run time and the power/status led has burned out. That is minor compared to the other issue it has developed where the power button only works about 10% of the time now. Total waste of money and an embarrassment for Corsair. Buy another.brand.
customer_reviews.author: Nate

customer_reviews.title: Great value
customer_reviews.text: Great value and price. Mid-Tower ATX, Large case, great quality, with plenty of room. Excellent port layout for cable management, great airflow. I used this case with an ASUS Strix 390-X, i7-9700K, CORSAIR RM750x , Corsair LPX 32GB, Cooler Master Hyper 212 Evo, EVGA RTX 2070 XC, WD BLACK 500GB NVMe Internal Gaming SSD , and Windows 10 to build a new gaming computer for about $1700. Much cheaper than buying a comparable system. Credit to Amazon and PCPartPicker among others. UserBenchmarks: Game 129%, Desk 151%, Work 138%
customer_reviews.author: IT guy in Lakeside

customer_reviews.title: Defective switch
customer_reviews.text: My new computer build failed to do anything after I got it assembled. After several hours of troubleshooting, I traced the problem to a defective ON button on the case. Since I did not get the unit assembled until after I had acquired all the parts, I am now past the 30-day return date. I am not happy. Now I am going to have to get a new case and disassemble/reassemble the whole system. I won’t be buying another Corsair case.
customer_reviews.author: Alfa_Romeo_fan

customer_reviews.title: Good-looking case that's untimately cheap and flimsy
customer_reviews.text: Looks clean, easy case in which to assemble pieces and parts, etc, but it's flimsy and seems junky. In my opinion, it's not worthy of being in the Corsair line. As a long-time purchaser who has been in a "PC building break" for a while, I was shocked by how "bendable" this case is. Even the USB ports feel crappy and loose. And I won't be surprised when anything screwed to the too-thin steel strips out (stand-offs, slot covers, expansion card retention screws, etc). I wonder if Corsair power supplies have become similarly junky? Bottom line: Corsair - we expect better.
customer_reviews.author: K. Kleinschmidt

customer_reviews.title: Excellent case
customer_reviews.text: I've used this case in 2 different builds and it's just great. You can save a lot of case money just buying this cheap case. A few things to note to make your life easy building in this case. 1- dont use hdd with this case. 2-remove the hdd bay and install a fan or two in the front. 3-put ssd in the disk drive bay or use m.2 instead. If you're going to use hyper 212 evo, put it horizontally instead of vertically or better use liquid cooler. 4-better use modular or semi modular psu with this case. Totally recommend buying this case.
customer_reviews.author: PegasusXXVI

customer_reviews.title: Did corsair change ownership ?
customer_reviews.text: I have been building PCs for about 20 years. I use as many corsair components at as I can because they have proven over time to be the front runner. I use their cases, RAM, and PSU's. I have noticed the quality of their products is in sharp decline. This case is the flimsiest, cheapest case I have ever worked with from them. I have a few different corsair model cases on the way for different builds, but if they are close to this quality, I will be done with corsair. Good luck on your purchase and I hope your luck is better than mine.
customer_reviews.author: Dennis C. Christian

customer_reviews.title: Solid ATX Case
customer_reviews.text: Exceeded expectations. Front face clips on and makes access to fans and drive bays effortless. Tool-less drive pods, including 4 2.5" pods I didn't even realize were there. Great cable routing options and tie-downs in the back. SEVEN fan spots! Top area might be a smidge tight for thick water-cooling radiators, but ymmv - I am air cooling so this is just how it looks to me. I would have appreciated a top cover for those of us who aren't adding fans up there, but for the price I cannot complain. Very impressed, will buy again.
customer_reviews.author: Richard Langis Jr.

customer_reviews.title: Basic but excellent
customer_reviews.text: This is my second build with the R200. All the holes line up, all the cards fit, fans work, enough room to work in but still compact. I know that sounds simple but I've built enough systems to know that this is often not the case (pun intended). Got this purchase on Prime Day for $50 bucks but even at its current $65 it's still a quality purchase. The case looks nice but is basic, put a few CPU/GPU/MOBO stickers on it if you want to spice it up. If you like RGB LED's, you're not looking at this case anyways. This is meant for business not fun. It just works.
customer_reviews.author: Ryan Schickel

customer_reviews.title: Light and Excellent Quality with Optical Drive
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this case to move my Ivy Bridge System into it for the next few years until I do a new build. Needed a modern (2019) case with an optical drive bay. Old case was CM Storm 31 lbs. This case is 14 lbs. So, with eliminating a second OP drive and putting in SFF PSU have reduce my weight from 45 lbs to less than 25 lbs.
customer_reviews.author: Michael D. Reif

customer_reviews.title: Corsair Carbide 200R
customer_reviews.text: I bought the 200R and think this is a very good quality product. I'm impressed with the fit and finish as well as the design. Before I purchased this I read the reviews and glad I went with this case as it's large, has a large number of options for fan mounting, and has drive bays. I'm actually surprised it was this inexpensive. For me, it is a great value case given the price and quality.
customer_reviews.author: Sunny Austin

customer_reviews.title: No top or side vent cover panels!
customer_reviews.text: I have an older relative of this case of similar design, and on the older model the top and side vent holes have covers that easily snap-in/out. This allows for more control over air-flow management. While the picture clearly shows there are no covers, I very wrongly assumed that was being done to show that the ventilation option is there. You can literally see where the snap points _would_ be, if the panels had been included. I checked Asus' website, and I do not see any option to purchase them as an add-on. Looks like they just took the old model, and threw away an important aspect of it to hit a price point. Very disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: Michael J Nordberg

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic for the price.
customer_reviews.text: (200R - since I think they mix reviews for other cases) I have built computers since the stone age (started in 1996) - and by far (for the money), this case is pretty great. Most everything is tool-less (nice feature), no sharp edges (smart design), and even comes with 2 fans already installed. I'm not so sure where all the negative reviews are coming from - but for a case that is about $70 - you cannot go wrong. Don't get me wrong - this isn't a $250 case - but if you don't demand much for a low-cost case, then this is your ticket. Never had a Corsair product before - and they won me over. Congrats, Corsair. :)
customer_reviews.author: R. Nelson

customer_reviews.title: The 110Q is not a quiet case
customer_reviews.text: The Q in the case model does not make this a quiet case. The metal is paper thin, and the crummy noise reduction material they glued on the inside doesn't server to mute the sound much. My hard drives (which were barely audible in my previous case) sound like my neighbor making popcorn. I can hear every gradient of fan speed changing with complete awareness. And the one 120mm exhaust fan in the back doesn't move air well, or quietly. Also, the thumbscrews are tiny, and the microscopic holes bent the first time I removed them so the holes no longer line up well. Boo. Poor effort. I absolutely do not recommend.
customer_reviews.author: DB

customer_reviews.title: pretty happy with this
customer_reviews.text: I am very satisfied with this case. I like the cable management and compartment that keeps the powersupply out of the way. Two things that were a bit different than expected: 1. The glass panel is darker than I thought it would be, so the led lights are not that bright. I actually prefer this though. 2. The mounting screws for the motherboard were hidden pretty well in the packaging. I didn't even find them until after I had already dug through old motherboard boxes to find others I had.
customer_reviews.author: TP

customer_reviews.title: Not enough airflow
customer_reviews.text: Graphics card runs hot unless I take the front cover off this case. It's simply does not have enough airflow while gaming. Non gaming applications it's AWESOME. Mother Board: Asus X570 Tuf CPU: AMD Ryzen 7 3700X RAM: 16 GB Corsair Vengance GPU: Asus RTX 2070 GTX Super Corsair H110 AIO (cpu stays at a cool 55c gaming) While gaming the GPU runs at 75c with the fans at full speed. If take the front off this case temps drop to the 60s and the fans run half speed making for a much cooler card and quieter experience. Don't get this case if you are going to push your hardware even the slightest bit.
customer_reviews.author: Mike

customer_reviews.title: No frills solid case
customer_reviews.text: One of my favorite Youtube pc builders uses this case a lot. I am not a gamer and do not want fancy lights or glass sides. This has neither. It has a place for optical drive and I still use that. The front fan is a bit loud and I may take it out at some point, maybe replace with a quieter one. Plenty of room to build in. It's pretty light but sturdy.
customer_reviews.author: William L. Anderson

customer_reviews.title: Good tower, but experience may be necessary
customer_reviews.text: Very solid mid-size tower. The tempered glass side has a tint to it which darkens the inside nicely and allows any lighting inside to stand out. The layout inside is pretty intuitive. It's hoped that anyone purchasing this case has some knowledge of PC builds because cable management is a must and there is somewhat limited storage space (SSDs and HDDs). Overall quality is good, but my case did come with a corner bent out of shape, however it did not affect my build and did not require fixing. There is definitely room for watercooling, but I do have to stress again that I recommend some experience with building PCs when working with this tower.
customer_reviews.author: William J. Mcloone

customer_reviews.title: I appreciate the lack of stupid windows, and useless LEDs
customer_reviews.text: As an almost 40 year old man, I appreciate the lack of stupid windows, and useless LEDs. It's reasonably well built for the price, no crazy sharp edges to slice your hand open on, and fairly well thought out layout. The fans are good, but not amazing. Plenty of room for drives and GFX cards. Room for a radiator if you're so inclined. And it's pretty quiet...especially with no spinning disks.
customer_reviews.author: Flankencharp

customer_reviews.title: Excellent PC Tower
customer_reviews.text: I love the versatility and size of this tower. I’m building my own PC and this mid-size tower is perfect for my setup. I really love the cord management holes throughout the case, as well as the PSU cover at the bottom. The screw holes that are placed throughout the case are also super universal so mounting various hardware brands makes it very easy. I also appreciate the RGB fan that it came with. Very high-quality case, no complaints here! I’ve bought Corsair products in the past and made no hesitation on this one. Amazing as always.
customer_reviews.author: Julia Marie

customer_reviews.title: Just shy of being great.
customer_reviews.text: The silent version of this case has three fan spots instead of five. It will run warm with most builds. I removed the hard/raid area and put the fans behind the holes instead of in front. The air flow was improved. It's almost a must do for the silent version. Lucky for me I'm running M.2 drives and will use the second drive bay for large hard drive. This case achieved the job of being very quiet with an eco/silent mode power supply and a video card that also has silent mode. I also like the over all look. Perfect for those who can't stand RGB.
customer_reviews.author: LL

customer_reviews.title: Love this case
customer_reviews.text: Ive been building pc's since the 90s and can honestly say this is my favorite case ever. Its not to small like the roseville micro atx case it replaced and not big like the antec server cases that were the rage in the early 2000s , no this case is like baby bears poridge just right. It is smartly designed aesthetically pleasing and super quiet. The only con was the led light didnt work
customer_reviews.author: Ronin

customer_reviews.title: Noticeably Quieter and looks great
customer_reviews.text: It's a really solid case. My two reasons for going with this one is how sleek it looks, and noise levels. I wanted something I could put in an entertainment center and not look like a total geek, and something that wouldn't sound like it was going to explode. While the noise levels are a little noticeable, even with "quiet" fans I put in as well, it's considerably quieter than the last tower I had previously.
customer_reviews.author: Cristian R

customer_reviews.title: Just an ok, no frills case. Spend more for a better experience.
customer_reviews.text: Case is just ok. It's good for someone on a tight budget who doesn't need anything fancy, but I would recommend spending a little more to get something of better quality. Pros: Lightweight. Easy to assemble. Side facing, tool-less drive bays are convenient. Lots of chassis cut outs for cable management. Cons: Thin metal. Cheap construction. Expansion slot metal bends. Adding upper fans is nearly impossible if you have a large cpu fan. Cheap plastic thumbscrews. Tool-less drive holders are flimsy and I broke a tab trying to remove a drive.
customer_reviews.author: Jay A.

customer_reviews.title: If a simple, modern case with a humble price is what you're after, you've found it.
customer_reviews.text: Bought two of these by accident, and liked it so much I decided to keep one for myself! I upgraded from an old Antec 900, and although it doesn't quite have the space of that big Antec, it has USB 3.0, a dust filter over the bottom vent, and it's much better setup for routing cables around the back side of the case (my Antec was a rats nest and then some). The only con so far is that it doesn't isolate the sound of my mechanical drive very much, so when it's writing to the platter you can hear EVERY scrape. However, if a simple, modern case with a humble price is what you're after, you've found it.
customer_reviews.author: Switch Box Tech

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Case, but Center Motherboard Anchor is Confusing
customer_reviews.text: This case is spacious, well made, and fairly easy to work with. There are no major issues, but one minor one - the central riser / motherboard mount does not have a bushing for a screw / bolt. It simply works as an anchor and protrudes a little bit. However, the manual that comes with the case makes NO mention of it, and doesn't show it in the drawings, which makes it seem like a defect. Corsair really needs to update the manual that comes with the case to mention the anchor. Nevertheless, I highly recommend this case.
customer_reviews.author: C.R.L and V.A.L.

customer_reviews.title: Insulated cases, a must
customer_reviews.text: Not the quick release door 🚪 like the Dell desktops, but way better because both sides open with 2 thumb screws each door 🚪, offers excellent accessibility and it's so much lighter and fits a standard ATX board as you'd expect. Fans are very versatile too, because of the 3 speed selection switch in the back, so if your CPU has a quietly and efficiently (low rpm) fan like the be quite dark rock 4 200 watt cooler more than capable of keeping my 95 watt ryzen 2600x processor cool 🏂, you can set these case fans to low and not have to ever change it unless you are doing something else of course.
customer_reviews.author: Mverovoy

customer_reviews.title: Really great case but mediocre build quality
customer_reviews.text: everything you expect from a case you have on this. This case has incredible cable management, looks great, modern front io, easy to build it, great fan support. The only flaw I have with this case is the quality of the material. I dont know if it plastic but it feels like it. I would've loved to pay 20 more bucks for a all metal micro atx version.
customer_reviews.author: Darien C

customer_reviews.title: Easy build
customer_reviews.text: I put in an old MATX poard. Installation was easy except for usb3 - the usb ports on the front case require a 20 pin connector, but my board didn't have one. I bought a $10 card from Amazon and solved the problem. I have built maybe a dozen desktops over the years. This was the first case I built where the the power supply is mounted at the bottom of the case. Luckily the cables were able to reach. The case comes with tow 20mm fans. Quiet and plenty of cooling for my 550 Watt rig.
customer_reviews.author: S. Milan

customer_reviews.title: No intake filters
customer_reviews.text: First of all, save yourself some time and install things in the proper order: Fans first (heatsync makes it hard), hard drives (power supply blocks access), motherboard, power supply, M.2 SSD, RAM, Processor, and then Graphics Card. I always forget to put the fans in and then I have to take everything out or strip the screws. My only complaint with this case is that there is no air filters for the intake fans. You'd think that there would be removable filters for the sides. Otherwise I like the looks and it works great.
customer_reviews.author: James

customer_reviews.title: Simple and efficient
customer_reviews.text: The case is perfect for me, it is easy to assemble and comfortable the only bad thing is that the cooler that came with it is damaged since every so often it made the feint of shutting down even though it was controlled by the motherboard, in fact barely I get to almost 900RPM. Before yesterday I replaced it with ARCTIC F12 PWM PST - 120 mm PWM PST Case Fan and it even lowered the CPU and GPU temperature by almost 10 °c.
customer_reviews.author: Korbmann

customer_reviews.title: Power Switch faulty, common problem
customer_reviews.text: Within 2 months of purchase, the power and drive activity lights went dead. From what I am reading in other reviews, this is due to faulty wiring between the switch and motherboard. BAD FORM, CORSAIR. Cheap parts make a cheap product. Too bad, because the case itself is made of sturdy material and is very quiet. I can repair the wiring, that's why I gave the 100R three stars overall. This company is not the Corsair that my 10 year old, 1,000 watt power supply came from.
customer_reviews.author: John Showalter

customer_reviews.title: Nothing too fancy which is why I like it.
customer_reviews.text: You won't be taking pictures to brag about your PC with this case, but it does more than enough. It doesn't let too much noise out, it has great space to hide the excess cables, it's got 3 places for external fans. GPU and CPU temps never reaches any high levels even when I ran them on full utilization for 3 days straight. The aesthetic is not the best out there, but I like it this way better. I like it more when things are great on the inside despite not looking too good on the outside.
customer_reviews.author: Ammar Salman

customer_reviews.title: Easy to work with, quiet enough
customer_reviews.text: I'm totally sold on the Corsair Carbides. They're light, spacious, tool-free where it counts (esp disk caddies!). I've built with Fractal Design, and Silverstone, and a couple of others that are a bit less obnoxious; but the first two are expensive, heavy, supposedly silent but no more so than one of these Corsairs, in the end; and they're inconvenient, even hard, to assemble and disassemble. The Corsairs were designed by someone who builds computers, not by someone in marketing. Now I have four home-builds in them. Love them.
customer_reviews.author: Philip

customer_reviews.title: Great case with space constraints
customer_reviews.text: Overall this is a great case. It's relatively quiet and incredibly easy to assemble and disassemble in order to access components. The materials are also high quality for the price range and it packs some great cable management options. My biggest complaint is that some of the space in the case is awkwardly allocated, with very little headroom for cable management in the back.
customer_reviews.author: Oliver

customer_reviews.title: Silent nights
customer_reviews.text: So nice and quiet. This is used for my home theater pc and its so quiet now the loudest thing in the room is my external hard drive. Thats with my build that consists of: ryzen 2600 cpu with artic freeze 33 passive cooler Rx480 gpu 16gb 3000mhz ram Nvme 500gb hard drive B450 mobo G3 gold rated psu with eco mode Overall very pleased, temps are never above 52c even when I play VR games. I found this by googling "silent pc build."
customer_reviews.author: lee

customer_reviews.title: Excellent case for the money
customer_reviews.text: This is an excellent case for the money. Cosmetically, it is sleek and unobtrusive. It's also easy to work with; it has a logical internal layout with the power supply at the bottom. It comes with preinstalled standoffs and several drive bays with easy-to-use brackets. There is a bit of soundproofing, but quietness will depend hugely on what kinds of fans and power supply you choose to install. Overall, the case worked well for my build, and I am very happy with it.
customer_reviews.author: Stian

customer_reviews.title: Bang for your buck
customer_reviews.text: An awesome value for a case that has higher end features. The built-in motherboard standoffs were great, but I had to remove and replace the bottom right mATX one because it had a metal pin instead of a screw hole and it made it impossible to screw the mobo in place. Luckily it came wirh an extra standoff. Also, I had to remove the rear fan because it made it extremely difficult to install the motherboard because the ports JUST BARLEY fit under it. Again, I just put the fan back on after the mobo was installed. After all is said and done, Id highly recommend this csse for beginner's or someone on a budget.
customer_reviews.author: Adam

customer_reviews.title: Low Quality PCIe card header brackets
customer_reviews.text: I want to be 100% crystal clear, I like this case I've used them for the last 15 or so PC builds and they are great however.... If you want to put a PCIe card like a video card into your computer please find a different case. The pot metal this case is made from is too flimsy to support having screws inserted and removed to hold a video/other card in place.
customer_reviews.author: Administrative Computer Consultants Co.

customer_reviews.title: Very good budget case
customer_reviews.text: Going from a master cooler case to this one is a dream. Cable management was a bit rough in terms of space but manageable. The disk trays for HDD and SSD are genius and super useful. The overall look of the case is clean and minimal. One thing I would change is the front vents. The vent from the sides and my room is cold so I have cold air constantly hitting my leg and I'm not sure how effective the cooling is venting from the sides. So far so good and would buy again
customer_reviews.author: Henry

customer_reviews.title: Great case and very quiet
customer_reviews.text: I really enjoyed my recent build with this case. Cables are easy to tuck away, the included fans are quiet and easy to plug into your power supply. I really like the ease of access to the USB ports, audio jacks and power buttons at the top front edge of the case. But the most surprising part is the sound absorbing foam on the interior of the removable side panels and the top of the case. I will be happy to look up this model or the newer version for my next build.
customer_reviews.author: Bobasaurus

customer_reviews.title: Loads of space!
customer_reviews.text: This chassis let's you put up to 6 drives, extremely expandable, great onboard cable management and amazing support for a variety of power supplies, mother boards and allows for up to 6 fans! Mind you it does come with 2 0.38 Amp fans and a bunch of screws to add anything you want! Only flaw here were the HDD clips are fairly fragile, I broke a clip 5 minutes into my build xD I do love that both panels come off, so mother boards are easy to install :)
customer_reviews.author: Ronan

customer_reviews.title: Good generic case for low noise, material on inside is poor quality
customer_reviews.text: Good nice looking budget mid-size case. The aluminum is very thin on the inside - one can bend parts of the chassis with their hands, for example. The hard drive bay mounts are cheap plastic and break easily. Not on the par of fancier cases but if one doesn't anticipate adding and removing drives often this case is sufficient. When fitted with noctua fans, it is absolutely silent.
customer_reviews.author: Scott Miller

customer_reviews.title: Great case.
customer_reviews.text: I cant say more about the case. The only limit is natively it can only hold two 3.5 SSD drives and two 5.25 spin drives. Beyond this issue, its a solid buy and I was happy they make the model with no stupid window so the ADHD kids can watch their rainbow colors.
customer_reviews.author: Happy Happy Joy joy

customer_reviews.title: HIGHLY recommended.
customer_reviews.text: This case was a breeze to build in, I even pre-ordered the 4000d airflow in white that they're releasing just to try it. This case has a very good amount of space, but I do recommend a semi-modular psu at the least. I had hardly any cable management, so I only had to use one zip tie. Airflow is superb if you have enough fans (last pic shows updated and current), and it has enough room for a 3 fan card as shown. Overall, this is a VERY good beginner case, even though I've been building PC's for years. I recommend this case to anyone!
customer_reviews.author: Cinder Valdivia

customer_reviews.title: Great case for the price point
customer_reviews.text: Great little case for the price point. Needed case on the lower price end for a everyday use build. Case can take two 140mm fans only problem was that it only came with 4 of the long fan screws so i only could mount one out of the box and had to find extras in my spare parts bin. Great cable organization and plenty of space for 3.5in drives. Would buy again if i needed to do a budget build.
customer_reviews.author: StandardShipping

customer_reviews.title: Looks good; quality construction; quiet
customer_reviews.text: I bought this case largely due to the fact that most cases now don't provide for mechanical optical drives. I have a bunch of legacy programs that are on DVD so I needed a case that could accommodate a DVD Drive. The Corsair Series 100R is such a case. I'm 100% satisficed with using it and would recommend it to other builders who aren't into the RGB trend.
customer_reviews.author: A. Galbraith

customer_reviews.title: Simple understated case, easy to work in for a first build.
customer_reviews.text: A good, well ventilated case for my first build. Cable management is easy if not pretty. I’m already thinking of what I’ll move my build into, though, now that I know what I’m doing. I do like that for now, it looks kind of understated and not like a flashy gaming rig. It makes me a bit more comfortable with the random people coming in and out of my apartment as they do repairs and renovations since the landlord decided now was THE TIME to do everything. It’s what’s inside that matters, anyway.
customer_reviews.author: otterb0t

customer_reviews.title: Great computer case! Would prefer aluminum front panel over plastic.
customer_reviews.text: I like this product, however I wish they could of made the front out of brushed black aluminum. The plastic front looks and feels a little cheap. An option to let the front fans breath a little better would also have been nice. Overall, if you are looking for a mid tower that has a windowed side case and still has 2 x 5.25” drive bays, then look no further. This is one of the few cases remaining on the market that still supports this option.
customer_reviews.author: Joey Douglas

customer_reviews.title: Excellent box for the money
customer_reviews.text: One of the lower cost boxes out there, but this does the job well. I like the card mounting, cable routing options and the drive mounting. You can hide a lot of the wiring in a channel between the drive bays and the motherboard on the back side of the chassis. Two 120mm fans included (3-pin). They're quiet. Mounting for two 3-1/2 inch drives and two 5-1/4 inchers. Who on earth needs two optical drives these days? The next iteration needs more 3-1/2" and maybe it's time for some real 2-1/2" slots for these SSD's? 5 stars anyway. Nice box for the money.
customer_reviews.author: tatanka

customer_reviews.title: Disappointing
customer_reviews.text: To be honest I was disappointed with the overall quality of this case at this price point. The cable management options are not good and the build quality seems very cheap. The bundle of wires for the case fan controller are not placed very well. When connecting the CPU power to the motherboard you have no option but to run it across the motherboard as there is no cutout at the top to run it through. Forget water cooling.
customer_reviews.author: Jim

customer_reviews.title: Very good for the price
customer_reviews.text: Very solid material and build quality. Pretty light. You can hear the fans inside which isn’t bad but it would be nice if it was a *little* quieter. My micro ATX mobo fit right in, the screws towards the edge are tough to reach, you’ll want a screwdriver with a thin handle. Very happy with it, it looks different and much more modern and professional compared to other cases people use.
customer_reviews.author: Nick

customer_reviews.title: Really nice case and light too
customer_reviews.text: My only complaint is the single headphone jack and not a duel jack on the top. I cannot get my mic to work. Also, parts are in the HD drive bay in a box. SSD's mount to the side of the case behind the MB. I didn't realize this becuse directions are so small I could not read them. Pretty happy with my purchase, price was good too.
customer_reviews.author: Buyer Rob

customer_reviews.title: This case seems to be well thought out.
customer_reviews.text: This case worked out pretty well. It seems like Corsair put some thought into different aspects. I can not remember any right now but I said to myself "Thats nice they put that there".
customer_reviews.author: Ryan

customer_reviews.title: So so
customer_reviews.text: It's an average case. Pro: Looks good. Plenty of space to manage cables. Easy to connect wires. Cons: Power supply sucks air in front underneath. Material/build is of low quality, if you don't treat it like fragile crystal you bend it. Overpriced for the quality; expected better from this brand.
customer_reviews.author: Charlie

customer_reviews.title: Decent for the price.
customer_reviews.text: I got this for my younger brother who was upgrading from Amd FX to Ryzen and wanted he new case. He still from time to time uses a Disk Drive so that was a mandatory feature in a potential case. This one gets the job done and is fairly easy to build in. My only gripes are the limited airflow, lack of a PSU shroud, and finally cable management is a little tight. But I suppose those are the compromises you get when going for a cheaper case. Otherwise it's solid for what it is sporting a low profile look.
customer_reviews.author: Aaron Yun

customer_reviews.title: Good case. Looks very nice as a living room PC, even with the window
customer_reviews.text: Good case. My actual gaming computer is in a much older case lol So I was impressed with the amount of cable management and just sheer room in this case. Not much front ventilation, so keep that in mind if you're putting an actual gaming rig in this, although you could probably stick a good rad for a water loop or CLC in the top where it has 2 fan mounts. Only comes with one rear exhaust fan though. I'll be using it for a living room PC as stated in the title, for which it looks great for, and I'm sure temps won't be a problem playing movies and watching Hulu... even if I don't add more fans...
customer_reviews.author: Jeremy

customer_reviews.title: Excellent compact ATX
customer_reviews.text: Great compact atx case, nice cooling, good cable routing, clean look, good quality build. No complaints about this case, would use it to build again in a heartbeat.
customer_reviews.author: Lance Thebodeau

customer_reviews.title: Quiet
customer_reviews.text: Nice case for my use. I wanted a quiet case because I use the computer for home office needs and importing body cam videos for editing. The HDD and run lights are a little bright but if the case is not at eye level they are OK. You are very aware when the HDD is working. A very good point. I installed a Linux Mint operating system so I needed a second computer to learn about Linux.
customer_reviews.author: bfd

customer_reviews.title: THE PERFECT CASE
customer_reviews.text: This is the Perfect Case for my next build I'm also getting the corsair water cooler same as shown in photo glad to know to that fits the case perfectly i was a little Concerned about rather it would fit or not glad to know that's not the case. my build wont be complete until either late November or December I'll have a video up at that time buy this case now this is best case in my opinion
customer_reviews.author: Lemont

customer_reviews.title: I love this case
customer_reviews.text: The first case I've got some screws didn't fit all the way in to secure the case side panels, also the bottom drive cage for 3.5 hard drive didn't secure. I've got a replacement and this one is perfect for me, a lot of space, for a mid-tower is big, has a very good cable management, my ATX motherboard fits perfectly, SSDs, hard drives, optical drives fits perfectly, plenty room for large GPUs, this thing is huge, just be gently when handling this case, it is cheap, so if you force it too much, parts will get loose or break, especially plastic parts, please, be careful. But I am very happy with this product. Also it is perfect for gaming.
customer_reviews.author: Amaru

customer_reviews.title: Only one SSD tray
customer_reviews.text: Well built case that looks amazing. But the fact that it comes with only one SSD tray is a huge let down. No where in the description or in the included items list does it mention the quantity of SSD trays.
customer_reviews.author: C_DOGG

customer_reviews.title: Mine came dented
customer_reviews.text: Product arrived with a large dent on the side. Since shipping it back would have been a hassle I decided to just use it.
customer_reviews.author: Johnathan Hartzell

customer_reviews.title: Second one I’ve bought... not as good as the first.
customer_reviews.text: Quality is going down. I thought it would be exactly the same as the last one I bought several years ago. But this one doesn’t not hold as many hard drives. Had to rig something up to get all 6 in. I’ve you do t need a bunch of space or great cable management... this case is fine. I’m a minimalist so this cases outside design is perfect for me. At least that hasn’t changed.
customer_reviews.author: N. Hedgeman

customer_reviews.title: Nice solid case!
customer_reviews.text: If you're not into lights and all that glory you see thru a window, in other words, you want a computer that works, this is a great case for a "normal" person/business class build! Highly recommended for cable management and ease of build. Has more drive bays than any "normal" person would ever need. Can't say enough good about the Corsair Carbide 200R
customer_reviews.author: Cruise

customer_reviews.title: Great Budget Mid Case.
customer_reviews.text: Pros, Very budget friendly case. Fits full ATX mobo plenty of room for HDs Looks pretty good cons cord routing space was super tight for a full modular power supply had to remove rear fan to install mobo (could reinstall fan after) Summary this makes a great budget friendly case for a patient build if you are in a hurry to put together a rig get a bigger case.
customer_reviews.author: Bradley

customer_reviews.title: 5 starts
customer_reviews.text: absolutely perfect. All of the reviews if you look are a couple of months old and they ordered the hundred model. I ordered the 110 Q I believe is the model name but it is an amazing computer the only issue is you need strong fans to be able to cool the interior. but other than that if I have to build another computer I will definitely get it. And considering I ordered it two days ago and it arrived almost 2 weeks early that’s just downright amazing
customer_reviews.author: Christian kositzke

customer_reviews.title: Inexpensive and Cheap
customer_reviews.text: Liked that it was relatively cheap. Looks nice but the mounts for the drives are thin plastic that wont securely hold the devices. Has only usb 3 connector so no front panel usb connections for the older mb. The usb connector is not backward compatible. I wouldn’t buy this again, mostly because of the usb only.
customer_reviews.author: dhd

customer_reviews.title: Good case
customer_reviews.text: Really quiet bare bones case. Some of the fittings are kind of delicate plastic but I didn’t have any problems with it. Really good case, but you really have to think your fans and air cooler out properly so that air flows through the case properly to keep the CPU cool because there’s no fan up top to send air out either.
customer_reviews.author: Mwilliams

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for my purpose
customer_reviews.text: The Corsair Carbide 100R Silent Edition case is perfect for my build. The size, shape, materials, and location of everything works well with my ASUS motherboard and Cooler Master 212 EVO heatsink fan. I have a total of four fans in the case. Overall, it's fairly quiet. It's not silent, but close. I guess the sound absorbing material does its job. My only tiny quibble is the power button. I wish it had an indent or a raised area so my finger could more easily find it in the dark under my desk. Great case!
customer_reviews.author: James G.

customer_reviews.title: Great quality, modest, budget minded case. FYI: Mine included two SSD brackets.
customer_reviews.text: This case is very subtle and includes most of the bells and whistles that enthusiast builders look for and expect. Tons of flexibility in terms of cooling and discrete cable routing. Fit my ATX mainboard and large graphics card easily. It only includes one 120MM fan... mounted high in front, which also provides the RGB factor of the Corsair "sails" logo on the face of this case. Many previous reviews brought to light their one con: they only received one SSD mount bracket... well, my purchase of this case on 2/12/2020 actually included the second SSD bracket (and thumbscrew). Perhaps Corsair heard their criticisms and rectified it. This is an excellent case, both in looks and function.
customer_reviews.author: Brandon K.

customer_reviews.title: Genuinely just a great machine
customer_reviews.text: I know this isn't the top quality some of you are looking for, but for the price and what I need it to do it's amazing! Everything fits perfectly and assembles intuitively. Cable management is a breeze. I haven't found a single thing I don't love about this case. It comes with everything you need and more.
customer_reviews.author: Al

customer_reviews.title: Small, Quiet, and Well-Constructed
customer_reviews.text: I wanted to move from a big, noisy case to a smaller, quieter one; this was the perfect choice. It fits snugly under my desk, and it is much quieter. The fan noise is much reduced, and I don't hear the hard drives spinning at all. It could use a few more USB ports on the front, but that's a minor issue. I had trouble with the power switch on the old case too, but not with this one. It is responsive and well-constructed. I will definitely stick with Corsair for future cases.
customer_reviews.author: Geoff

customer_reviews.title: its got a lot of very nice features. Thumbscrews for opening the side panels and ...
customer_reviews.text: I wanted to build a new linux box and picked this case because of its low price. Despite being extremely inexpensive, its got a lot of very nice features. Thumbscrews for opening the side panels and tool-less drive bays are nice. The overall finish is quite nice, but some parts of it seem a bit plasticy and cheap (e.g. the drive bays). Not an issue for me but if you're looking to dress up a fancy gaming rig and you want it to look super fancy, this one may not be the right choice. Not listed in the specs, but comes with 4 SATA cables.
customer_reviews.author: Tyler Gunn

customer_reviews.title: as advertised
customer_reviews.text: well packaged, on time delivery. Great access and extremely easy to install motherboard and all related parts. Manual of parts handy and to the point. Only problem was, wait, no problems at all.
customer_reviews.author: Joseph A. Delinski Jr.

customer_reviews.title: Minimalistic and Overall Great!
customer_reviews.text: This case is great and I have been using it for years now. The size is great, and I will rank it as a medium esque size. The material would be my only complaint because it is all plastic, including the see-through the side panel. However, I knew this when purchasing the case, so you get what you pay for.
customer_reviews.author: Alex

customer_reviews.title: Gorgeous Case - Bad SSD Mounts
customer_reviews.text: Just about everything with this case is fantastic, and the glass window looks amazing. My only issue is the SSD mounts. They lay flat against the left side--attached to the wire management panel. It's a great location, but once they're mounted you have to severely bend the power wire for it to connect.
customer_reviews.author: Daniel

customer_reviews.title: Utility case, OK as that.
customer_reviews.text: Nothing fancy here, think of as more convenient case than is supplied with an inexpensive retail computer. Used it to build a NAS out of an older motherboard and about 5 drives I had lying around, good enough for that. Front panel USB connections inadequate, only comes with the 3.0 plug. Not a stopper in my use case. Bought at Prime Day sale, not worth full price.
customer_reviews.author: HRJ

customer_reviews.title: Great looking case for a modest build.
customer_reviews.text: I used this case for my first ever build. It has an excellent look and the tempered glass has a light tint on it so only the RGB can be seen. I highly recommend picking up at least 2 extra fans as the case fan doesn't move much air around. I went with the Af120. The case is extremely easy to set up and take apart. I did have to remove the HDD cage to fit the cords through however. Also, the 2.5 ssd slots aren't fitting perfectly but are functional. Overall, it is a very attractive minimalist case for a modest build.
customer_reviews.author: Josh

customer_reviews.title: Decent but just okay for the price
customer_reviews.text: The case is really lightweight compared to other cases I’ve had. I’ve built a lot of PC’s myself over the years. You can definitely tell this is a cheap case by the quality of the plastic. It looks okay from far away though. It does the job I suppose. Some things I didn’t like are 1) having two screws to remove the plate over the expansion cards. 2) The hard drives go in connectors first into their cages. I wish I had spent a few more bucks on a case in the $80 range which I think would have been a better value.
customer_reviews.author: Peter A. Rodriguez

customer_reviews.title: great case but a bit on expensive side, if you could buy on sale well worth it
customer_reviews.text: cable management is ok and doable, case is thick enough not be bent or whatever someone posted pictures of, flipped this case inside out built my rig and looks great, not too many cases there with a 5.25 bay and usb ports and light in front where from far you can see what going on.
customer_reviews.author: Andrey Boryozka

customer_reviews.title: Disappointing build standard and...
customer_reviews.text: the metal was pretty flimsy. Fit/finish was just OK. The case is not bad at all just it feels like a cheaper case than the price - I feel there are better options for the money. I replaced with a Phantek Enthoo Pro (more money - but not much more) and was much happier with it.
customer_reviews.author: Amazonian

customer_reviews.title: A noble first computer case (or something to slap spare parts in)
customer_reviews.text: The price doesn't match the quality. Yes it's a bit flimsy, but everything is in the right spot, lined up, and with some patience goes together fine. Even can do a little cable management if you care about that sort of thing. It comes with a manual (a bit more like a small bound book!) that basically teaches you how to put computers together. Kinda wish I had that back in the day!
customer_reviews.author: Alexander L Grotewohl

customer_reviews.title: Great Budget Case!
customer_reviews.text: This case is a great budget case. It has good cable management holes that makes routing cables easier. The noise level wasn't bad either for a steel case. The only thing I would improve is the rigidity at the rear of the case as it seems a little too easy to bend. Otherwise this case is great for microATX and ATX builds.
customer_reviews.author: CRAIG C BAILEY

customer_reviews.title: Made a nice gift for my nieces and easy to use.
customer_reviews.text: I recently built an i5 CPU computer for my niece. I used this Mid-Case Tower. It was cheap and well built. Also, the parts fit into place without any problems so it was an easy build. The material quality is good. It should last a while, and it was easy on the budget. Overall, a win win situation. My nieces loved the new PC and my pocketbook also liked the low price for this case.
customer_reviews.author: JOSE A. DUARTE

customer_reviews.title: The CPU cut out in the back didn't line up ...
customer_reviews.text: The CPU cut out in the back didn't line up with my old X58 ATX mobo, i was very limited on the CPU cooler i could use. Corsair H50 would not fit, same with Cooler Master V8 cooler. EVGA Superclock CPU cooler barely fit inside this case on my x58 mobo. (old system i threw together to giveway to someone in need) If i had to do it over again, i would of bought a Phanteks mid-tower case instead.
customer_reviews.author: Customer

customer_reviews.title: great case and support
customer_reviews.text: Not my first rodeo, so everything went together fine. Love the case - bottom mounted PSU is a first for me, first new case in a decade. really like that. The box of stand offs and screws were a bit light - MB screws were missing. I grabbed some from the junk box and all was well. I mentioned to Corsair the missing screws, and that I was fine, didn't want any, just letting them know. They sent a new box of hardware anyway. Bottom line, a great box to mount your gear and a great company to make sure you have plenty of screws. Happy endings all around.
customer_reviews.author: Jim

customer_reviews.title: Corsair case
customer_reviews.text: flexible mid-tower, easy assembly of components as well as cable management. Added hush kit for additional fan noise reduction. 5.25" bays for DVD rom(s). Clean looking appearance with white LED's along with 3rd party white color back lit case fans makes make for interesting contrast with case (black). Hope Corsair continues to manufacture cases with 5.25" bays.
customer_reviews.author: Up North

customer_reviews.title: Would recommend 10/10
customer_reviews.text: Hated the "gamer" look and was looking for something that wasn't too flashy and didn't scream "gamer". I didn't want any windows or flashy lights. I was looking for something more discreet. There weren't too many options out there, but this fit the bill perfectly. Build quality is good. Came with all the screws and cables you need. It is very quiet and has tons of room for future expansion.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Compact case with good aesthetics
customer_reviews.text: Great looking, simple case with just enough room for an ATX board. Temps aren't the greatest, but it beats having a jet engine as a case, so it has good sound dampening abilities. Tempered glass panel is quite heavy duty with plenty of tint, so if ypu want to RGB, get some bright LED fans.
customer_reviews.author: RockyDennis

customer_reviews.title: Great gaming case
customer_reviews.text: Using a smaller Asus ATX mobo, I was still able to install a water cooling system, pcie graphics and full ram slots. The only complaint I had is that the connector plate that snaps in place is a very poor fit. Hard to get into place without man handling it.
customer_reviews.author: Michael Kerr

customer_reviews.title: Great Case, Amazing Price, super quiet.
customer_reviews.text: All I can say is this is a great case. Great airflow, huge inside, actually surprised that this is considered a "compact" atx case, because it is huge compared to a previous case of similar specs. Everything is neatly labeled, wire routing and runs very quietly. Was able to complete a build in about 40 mins with this case. Only gripe is that I wish they had this identical case in pure white. Would buy 2 again in a heartbeat.
customer_reviews.author: Another Customer

customer_reviews.title: I bought this case after a cpu of mine got ...
customer_reviews.text: I bought this case after a cpu of mine got damaged and my CH6 motherboard wouldn’t post So I’m waiting for RMA. It has standoff’s for a ATX and mAtx motherboard. With my CH6 it was tight and interesting trying to route cables and whatnot. Now I have a B350-e mAtx backup board which I think the case is more gear towards. Pros: 1. Windowed 2. 5(6) fan mounts (with 5.25 bays removed/ unutilize) 3. Includes one fans 4. Modular mounting for drive bays and HDD Cons: 1. Small and restrictive 2. “Modular” design
customer_reviews.author: Gabriel E.

customer_reviews.title: Great mid-size tower for the price, Corsair makes great cases for the price.
customer_reviews.text: For the price and free shipping, I couldn't be happier. It should run a 120mm water-cooled system with no problems. Be sure to check your motherboard size and dimensions first. To install front intake fans would be a bit silly. There is only a small vent at the top of the front of the case. I ordered two AF120s to keep airflow going and installed them on the top of the case. (works fine, everything runs cool)
customer_reviews.author: Sean

customer_reviews.title: Good looking case. Easy to work with
customer_reviews.text: This has been a nice case to build in, good quality and reasonable price. Not much space behind the motherboard tray but if you have flat power supply cables it is not much of an issue. Allows for hard drive bay removal for an extra case fan in front if you wanted it arranged that way. Overall this is exactly what I needed for my new build, very happy with this purchase.
customer_reviews.author: mneri

customer_reviews.title: It' quiet
customer_reviews.text: I wanted a quiet case and this one does its job. Things get a little tight running the cables from a big 850 watt power supply, but it's doable. For the price it's a good case. And it one of the few cases left that has room for an optical drive. I still burn and play cds and dvds and did not want an external drive.
customer_reviews.author: Ben Z

customer_reviews.title: First class product from Corsair.
customer_reviews.text: This is one of the best cases money can buy at this price point. With lots of rooms to build, a decent layout for wire management, motherboard compatibility with both atx and micro atx, and did I say lots of room? Eight spots for hard drives, seven pci slots, eight fan mounts, and room for three optical drives all at once. The case in itself is extremely solid. Sleek black with white led lights, I call this case the sleeper. For first time builds this case will have you feeling extremely confident in where to put the wiring, and installing the components. I don't see any case this good at this price point.
customer_reviews.author: brafar1824

customer_reviews.title: Decent case, other than the occassional buzzing from the front chassis fan
customer_reviews.text: The case is pretty good, with solid build quality and many features you'd expect from some more expensive cases. I did have a couple annoying issues: 1. The front chassis fan caused a buzzing noise throughout the whole case when it reached higher speeds. 2. Trying to fix this involved removing the front panel to get to the fan, which was strangely difficult. Otherwise, decent case. Maybe my fan issue is a fluke.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Incredible Case for the Money!
customer_reviews.text: This case is an incredible value. I’ve built two computers using it now, and it is laid out very well, has drive rails that make the hard drives and disc drives quick to install, the two large fans provide excellent cooling (and give 3-pin or SATA power options, and the case is extremely quiet with sound-absorbing padding lining most surfaces. I am so impressed. The front USB and audio ports have worked perfectly on both cases. You won’t find anything close to comparable for this price.
customer_reviews.author: D T

customer_reviews.title: Great case
customer_reviews.text: This is the second one of these I’ve purchased, and I think they’re great. Easy cable management, plenty of room. I appreciate that it’s also mostly a normal looking case, without all of the gimmicky “gamer flair” you see on a lot of other cases.
customer_reviews.author: Brandon A. Stecklein

product_meta.title: Corsair CC-9011075-WW Carbide Series 100R Mid Tower Case
product_meta.description:
Color:Window| Size:Standard| Style:100RThe Carbide Series 100R Mid Tower case lets you hide a high-powered, killer gaming rig inside of a case that would look at home in any professional environment. It's easy to customize with plenty of tool-free installation options, highly expandable with extra fan ports and drive bays to support SSDs, and performance-minded with USB 3.0 support and direct airflow to the GPU. The Carbide Series 100R looks simple and elegant from the outside, but the inside provides you with all the options you need for a killer rig. 
Customer Service / Tech support: 1-888-222-4346 opt. 1
feature_bullets: Elegant, Modern Design: With a mesh-free front panel, the 100R is both professional enough for the office and customizable enough for any home PC build
USB 3.0 Compatible: Dual USB 3.0 front panel ports offer the best in connectivity.
SSD Support: All four hard drive trays provide solid-state drive support. Compatible corsair liquid coolers is h55, h60, h75, h80i. Maximum cpu cooler height is 5.9 inch. Maximum psu length is 9 inch
Direct Airflow to Top GPU: Direct airflow gives your GPU added cooling for intense gaming sessions
Up To Five Fan Mounts Plus One Included 120mm Fan: A 120mm fan gets your cooling off the ground, and extra mounts provide added expandability
Tool-free 3.5" and 5.25" Drive Installation: Builds are made easier with tool-free drive installation
Thumbscrew Side Panels: No tools are needed to easily access the inside of your case
Flush-Mounted Side Panel Window: The side panel window showcases the powerful components inside

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.5 out of 5 stars5,090 ratings4.5 out of 5 stars
